did.physdesc: This collection consists of 63 items (1 Hollinger box, ca. .5 linear feet).

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Anyone wishing to quote from these materials must contact Breece Pancake's literary executor, John Casey, for permission.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of Breece D'J Pancake, Accession #10975-a, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These papers were given to the University of Virginia Library on February 16, 1994, by John Casey, Charlottesville, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The papers chiefly contain correspondence about Pancake's search for employment or other opportunities, including several copies of his curriculum vitae, two religious books and a Bible owned by him, and several of his short stories and English class papers. There are also two letters from Helen Pancake to John Casey which discuss the appearance of an article about Breece Pancake in American Short Story Writers Since World War IIand a biography about Pancake by Tom Douglass.
